jobs.description:

Day in the lifeHands-on technical work daily, involving system design, implementation & operational problem-solving. 75% system building, 25% operational analysis & client interaction.Analyze law firm technology challenges and operational bottlenecksConfigure CRMs & Case Management systems to solve for the bottlenecksBuild analytics dashboards and data pipelines that reveal actionable insightsDesign automation workflows using tools like Zapier, Make, and n8nDeploy and train client teams on AI solutions that actually drive impactBuild working relationships with clientsAutonomously get insights from & present to client teams
Why this changes everything for youIf you're tired of corporate bureaucracy and slow career progression, this is where ambitious technical professionals unlock their full potential. You'll showcase your expertise in operational problem-solving while working with the latest AI and automation technologies that create exponential opportunities.You'll make meaningful technical impact from month one - no committees, no approvals, just you working with your clients to identify operational problems and implement technical solutions that directly transform business efficiency.Every client engagement is your laboratory for mastering both the newest technology and operational optimization.
What we needSystems thinking approach - You naturally see how technical solutions connect to business outcomes, and can solve hard problems autonomouslyBuilder mentality - You genuinely enjoy the process of designing, testing, and perfecting systems with high attention to detailTechnical experience - Proven track record of deploying & configuring CRMs, Project Management systems, and Automation tools (Low-Code/No-Code)Ownership mentality - You like to get your hands dirty and pull through challenges autonomously, you take pride in your work and don't need micromanagementCuriosity - You are excited to learn new tools & skills and can do so quickly, you are eager to adapt your approach if someone shows you a better way of solving a problem, you are coachableClient-ready communication skills - You'll present to law firm staff and senior executives, you will need to translate complex technical concepts to a non-tech-savvy audienceProfessional English fluency - You'll advise successful US-based law firms, B2 level at a minimum
Ideal background3+ years of experience in similar rolesExperience with CRMs (e.g. HubSpot, Salesforce)Experience with Project Management Systems (e.g. Asana, Monday.com)Experience with automation tools (e.g. Zapier, Make, n8n)Experience working with REST APIs (integration)Track record of learning complex tools quickly and applying them to business problems(Optional) Experience with legal tools (e.g. Clio Manage and Lawmatics) or working in a law firm is a plus, but NOT a requirementPortfolio preferred - showcase projects that demonstrate your systematic problem-solving approach.
This role will NOT be a fit ifYou are looking for a relaxed job environment, this job is intense and you will be pushed to your LIMITS on a daily basisYou want to be assessed on your inputs, this role will require you to own your OUTPUTS and your clients' resultsYou prefer to work in a managerial capacity, this role requires HANDS-ON building & deployment of systems and interacting with clients, you will own your projects end-to-endYou prefer pure technical implementation without business interaction, this role requires operational analysis skills and direct client COLLABORATION as well as technical executionYou're looking for hands-on coding opportunities, our team works exclusively with low-code and NO-CODE platforms rather than traditional developmentThis role is for those who want to own their impact, accelerate their growth, and build systems that matter.
Location & scheduleFully Remote (with quarterly in-person meetups).Availability for client meetings: Mon - Fri, 2pm - 10pm Eastern European Time (EET); rest of time can be used for working on your responsibilities or tackling internal meetings on an ad-hoc basis.
CompensationCompetitive salaryPerformance-based bonus & promotion pathFlexible benefitsCareer-defining growth investment: we spent over $100,000 on team development last year – executive coaching, certifications, and training that accelerates your career beyond any traditional path
Our MissionThe legal industry is broken – outdated, overpriced, and structurally rigged against innovation and access. Today, 92% of low-income households can’t afford legal help, and meaningful reform is blocked by laws that prohibit non-lawyers from owning or operating law firms.This shuts out entrepreneurs and business leaders who drive real change. At the same time, firms are confined by state-level regulations that make it hard to scale across jurisdictions, limiting competition and protecting inefficiency. While other industries have embraced technology, law firms are still stuck in the past – reliant on paper, billable hours, and outdated systems.Our mission is to change that. By equipping law firms with cutting-edge tech and world-class operations, we will push the industry 10 years forward – delivering faster, better, and more affordable legal services at scale.
Swans Core ValuesValue alignment is non-negotiable. Because of the close collaboration with the founding team and the direct impact on clients, it's essential that you genuinely connect with and embody our commitment to Care. Our standards are high - historically, only 3% of candidates possess the rare combination of technical aptitude, problem-solving skills, and cultural alignment we require.Care for Ourselves: We push ourselves to grow every day. We take full responsibility for our lives and choices. That means taking care of our mental, physical, and emotional health so we can consistently show up at our best. If we’re not growing, we’re falling behind.Care for Our Team: We work as one team. No internal competition, no egos. We help each other win and give honest feedback when something’s off. We check in, offer help before it’s asked for, and never let a teammate struggle alone. If one of us fails, we all do. If one of us wins, we all benefit. When someone needs something, do it better and faster than expected.Care for Our Clients: We focus on real outcomes, not just fulfilling requests. Clients trust us to solve the right problems, not just follow instructions. That means delivering practical, effective solutions that actually move the needle. It also means managing relationships with clear communication and follow-through.Care for Swans: Swans exists because a group of people believed in the vision and put skin in the game. For this to work long-term, we need to protect and grow the company. That means putting Swans first when it matters. When the company wins, we all win. That includes making sure our early backers see the return they deserve.Care for Our World: Low-income households receive no or inadequate legal help for 92% of their legal problems. This gap leaves millions navigating critical issues like housing, healthcare, and family matters without the support they need. We are on a mission to create a more just and equitable society by making legal services accessible across all income levels.

jobs.title: SEM Manager (Bilingual English/French)
jobs.description:

jobs.title: Search Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Spekk has been named one of the UK’s top 100 companies to work for in 2025 by the Culture 100 Awards, recognising the nation’s most loved workplaces.
Who we are:We are Spekk; a digital advertising agency for high-consideration products. We help businesses with complex offerings increase their sales by combining the power of algorithms with human empathy, storytelling and style. Our primary way of doing this is through our Paid Media Management service, which is at the heart of our business. In addition to this, we also offer creative campaign development and social first content production.
About the Paid Search Manager Job:
What you would do in this role:At Spekk the majority of our work is done within three different client verticals; travel & experiences, high-growth start-ups and high-end e-commerce - this is where you come in.As a Senior SEM Manager at Spekk you’ll support a core part of our business: running paid search for clients. With the type of clients we have, paid social is often the main source of growth, but increasingly we rely on paid search for these clients as well, and we are looking for someone who can initially take on 3–5 clients we run paid search for at the moment (alongside paid social). This means that while you are responsible for the success of your accounts, you’ll be able to bounce strategy off more senior team members and be supported by motivated juniors and technical experts.
In the future, this role can develop into managing paid search across all clients and building a team specifically for SEM. We’re looking for someone who can grow into owning the paid search ‘department’.
In this role, you’ll work on specific client accounts alongside a two-person team on each account. Other teammates will be in charge of project management, client comms and paid social, and you will plug into these client teams to provide strategy, execution and analysis for paid search specifically.
Who this role is for:People who dig deeper. The type of products we market are high-consideration, which means they have complex consumer buying journeys. A superficial understanding of a challenge or problem won’t cut it.You’ve run Google Ads professionally for 3+ years for several different industries, preferably at an agency.Experience from small agencies: you should be super crafty; equally comfortable with a smaller budget as you are with the responsibility of handling a large one.Both sides of the brain. The role requires both analytical and creative thinking, so you’ll need to be not just well-rounded, but more or less perfectly spherical.Curiosity killed the cat, but made your career. Candidates should be inquisitive, ask questions and be hungry for knowledge.Really, really, really great people. We’re hard-working and highly motivated, but we’re also here to enjoy our work. Ideally, you’d be someone who looks out for others and revels in being social. The team mostly works remotely, but we meet up on team trips all over the world.
What you’ll get:Working with fun & fascinating businesses – think music festivals in tropical locations or Regenesis – Novak Djokovic’s new entrepreneurial venture.The chance to travel while your investment banker friends are slurping noodles at 2 am somewhere dreadful like Canary Wharf.The freedom of working remotely, but with trips every year to meet up with the team.A meritocracy, free from red tape or stupid barriers to your personal development – take Stephen as an example; he made Partner 4 years after joining as an intern.
Timings & remuneration:Start date: Autumn 2025. Full-time position, in it for the long run.We’re flexible around employment forms depending on location - we can figure out what suits both sides best.Remuneration: £40,000 - £55,000 per year depending on experience.
Benefits & Perks:Team trips to places like Barcelona, Nice and Mallorca (2-3 per year).£500 one-off allocation for home office set-up.Fully remote workforce with team members based in the UK, Sweden, Spain, Germany, France and Portugal.Casa Spekk in Barcelona (our own ‘brand home’). Whenever you are in town you can take full advantage of this collaboration space.
Please apply if...You’re highly proficient in written and spoken English.UK/EU based.You’ve worked in Google Ads Manager for 3+ years.You've also worked with Facebook Ads a fair bit.You have experience in B2B and B2C SEM strategies.You have proven experience analysing audience data, traffic analytics, and channel performance and recommending improvements.You have good knowledge of Google Analytics, GTM, UTM building and related tracking technologies.You consider yourself very strategic.You’re a human calculator.You're the person in a meeting everyone looks to for answers.You know how to manage clients - even when they frustrate you.When you sleep at night, you dream of neatly organised spreadsheets.You fall to your knees in despair when a comma is out of place, a formula doesn’t add up, or you’re missing a piece of a puzzle.You can work during UK office hours (we’re pretty flexible, but you’ll need to be around for meetings).
Bonus points if...You’d rather spend your money seeing the world than buying more of what’s in it.You speak more than one language.You are the person who always knows the new trends.You have a morally and/or legally questionable story from your gap year to tell us.You'd go to Burning Man over Coachella.You can mix a killer mezcal cocktail.
How to applyPlease fill out the application form at www.spekk.com/apply.

En parallèle de ces différentes missions, il sera également indispensable de prendre le temps de comprendre les spécificités de notre produit et d’analyser notre cible. Le secteur bancaire est dynamique et exigeant, chaque action de l’équipe marketing est donc guidée par une nécessité de renforcer la confiance de nos prospects envers nos produits. Cela nous amène à choisir la qualité à la quantité dans nos démarches, y compris en ce qui concerne nos initiatives de croissance.

L’équipe

Vous rejoindrez notre équipe Marketing, actuellement composée de 7 personnes réparties sur des sujets de growth marketing, contenu, événementiel, et product marketing. Priscilla, notre Head of Marketing, pilote l’activité globale de l’équipe, et vous travaillerez sous la responsabilité directe de Vincent, notre Growth Marketing Manager.

Notre équipe est encore à taille humaine. Vous deviendrez rapidement une référence concernant les sujets d’inbound marketing et la gestion des projets, au sein de l’équipe Marketing et des autres équipes avec qui vous serez amené·e à collaborer (Sales, Product…).

Le salaire

À travers notre processus de recrutement, nous évaluons vos compétences afin de vous positionner dans notre matrice de niveaux.

Nous recherchons pour ce poste un profil qui peut être niveau 3 (intermédiaire), le salaire de référence est alors de 59 000 € brut annuel, ou niveau niveau 4-1 (senior 1) : le salaire de référence est alors de 67 800 € brut annuel.

À propos de vous

Profil recherché

Nous recherchons pour ce poste une personne ayant déjà travaillé sur un poste similaire en B2B, dans un contexte de croissance, idéalement sur un produit à destination des PME ou des directions financières.

Vous êtes passionné·e par les aspects techniques du marketing digital : vous maîtrisez les outils clés de votre métier, et n'hésitez pas à en explorer de nouveaux si cela peut améliorer vos résultats. Vous êtes à jour sur l’impact des LLM dans le référencement et vous utilisez l’IA au quotidien pour améliorer vos performances. Ingénieux·se et créatif·ve, vous aimez expérimenter, tester, ajuster, et lancer des campagnes percutantes, conçues pour marquer les esprits et produire des résultats concrets.

Bien que vous soyez guidé·e par l’atteinte d’objectifs de croissance, vous êtes également attaché·e à la qualité de votre approche et reconnaissez la nécessité de consacrer du temps à comprendre en profondeur les particularités de notre produit et de notre cible. Vous savez mettre à profit votre esprit analytique pour y parvenir.

Vous appréciez le travail en équipe, et savez collaborer avec des profils aux expertises variées pour enrichir vos initiatives et en multiplier l’impact.

Compétences attendues

Vous avez travaillé au sein d’une start-up ou scale-up orientée B2B sur un poste similaire pendant au moins 5 ans ;Vous savez coordonner plusieurs projets en même temps ;Vous maîtrisez les principaux canaux d’acquisition marketing ;Vous avez une excellente maîtrise du CRM (nous utilisons Hubspot) ;Vous avez déjà géré de A à Z des campagnes d’acquisitions payantes, et possédez une excellente maîtrise des outils (Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads…),Vous êtes à l’aise pour faire parler les chiffres, et utilisez quotidiennement des outils de tracking comme GA4, Google Tag Manager ;Vous maîtrisez les bonnes pratiques en matière de SEO et GEO ;Vous savez manier les LLM pour améliorer la qualité de votre travail et être plus performant ;Une disposez d’excellentes capacités de communication écrites et orales ;Vous maîtrisez l’anglais, notamment à l’écrit — notre communication interne est en anglais.

Vous n’avez pas besoin de posséder 100 % des compétences listées ci-dessus pour nous écrire. Si vous pensez avoir la plupart des qualités requises pour ce poste, à l’exception d’une ou deux, écrivez-nous quand même. Et si une petite voix vous dit que vous feriez mieux d’attendre, ignorez-la et envoyez-nous votre candidature malgré tout. Les personnes qui travaillent chez Memo Bank ne cochaient jamais 100 % de nos cases au moment où elles nous ont écrit. Elles ont simplement tenté leur chance en se disant qu’elles feraient de leur mieux si elles étaient prises. Vous êtes sans doute dans le même état d’esprit, alors allez-y.

Comment postuler

La candidature

Envoyez-nous votre CV (ou votre profil Linkedin) et un texte (en français) nous expliquant pourquoi vous souhaitez nous rejoindre. Nous n’attendons pas une lettre de motivation formelle. Parlez-nous plutôt de ce que vous pensez pouvoir nous apporter et de ce que vous aimeriez recevoir en retour. Sans lettre de votre part, nous ne pourrons pas statuer sur votre candidature.

Les entretiens

Notre processus de recrutement se veut adaptable et réactif.

Voici ce à quoi vous pouvez vous attendre si votre candidature est retenue :

Premier entretien téléphonique avec Jeanne, Talent Acquisition Specialist (45 minutes) ;Test écrit à faire chez vous à votre rythme (2 heures de travail environ) ;Entretien technique en visio avec Vincent, Growth Marketing Manager, et Priscilla, Head of Marketing (1 heure) ;Entretiens avec des membres de différentes équipes en visio (1 heure 30 environ).

Nous avons à cœur d’offrir un environnement de travail inclusif, c'est-à-dire un espace où chaque personne peut exprimer son individualité de manière authentique, sécurisante et valorisante. Nous sommes convaincus que c’est la diversité de parcours, expériences, cultures et perspectives qui fait la richesse d’une équipe, et le succès d’un projet. Nous avons construit un processus de recrutement fondé sur les compétences, dont vous trouverez le détail sur notre blog. Si vous avez besoin d’un aménagement au cours de l’une de ses étapes, faites-le nous savoir dans votre candidature ou lors de votre entretien téléphonique.

We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

About the Role:We’re looking for a hands-on, entrepreneurial Head of Operations to serve as the CEO’s right hand and second-in-command. This role is central to scaling Panda Drum’s global operations, supply chain, and fulfillment while driving cost efficiency and systemization. The ideal candidate isn’t a corporate “process admin” - you’re a builder-operator: someone who thrives in fast-moving environments, builds systems from the ground up, and treats the business like it’s your own. You’ll oversee operations across supply chain, fulfillment, and vendor management, while also running point on key growth initiatives (Amazon, wholesale, licensing, subscriptions). When the CEO is not in the room, you’re the one running the business.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):Oversee and optimize supply chain, fulfillment, vendor relationships, and customer support operations.Implement scalable systems, dashboards, and SOPs for real-time visibility, efficiency, and growth.Manage cost efficiency across gross margins, landed costs, fulfillment expenses, and vendor terms.Lead key growth initiatives: Amazon expansion, wholesale channel roll-out, subscription app scaling, and licensing partnerships.Build, mentor, and manage a lean, high-performing team (3–5 initially, scaling to 10–15) across Operations, Product, and Sales support.Act as the CEO’s second-in-command, ensuring the business runs smoothly and operational fires are minimized.Drive performance tracking and reporting through data-driven metrics and dashboards (Google Sheets, Looker Studio, ERP).Collaborate closely with marketing, product, and leadership teams to align operational execution with strategic growth goals.Ensure high levels of communication and accountability with vendors, 3PLs, and international partners (China, US, EU).Maintain flexibility and urgency in responding to critical operational issues, including outside regular hours when necessary.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Transition from Head of Operations to COO within 12–18 months.Long-term potential for equity/ownership stake based on results.Direct exposure to global growth projects: licensing (Disney, Warner Bros.), subscription apps, wholesale expansion.Unlimited book/course budget for professional development.Paid international travel (China, US, EU).Work alongside top-tier e-commerce consultants and operators from $100M+ brands.Flexible, remote-first work culture with focus on results over hours.
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You take ownership.You treat the business as if it’s your own - you don’t just manage tasks, you own outcomes, solve problems, and drive results without waiting for direction.
You build scalable systems.You think in processes, not patches. You create SOPs, dashboards, and workflows that keep operations running smoothly and can scale as the business grows.
You thrive in fast-paced environments.When things move quickly and priorities shift, you stay calm, adapt, and keep execution on track without losing focus..

jobs.title: Wallet Operations Specialist
jobs.description:
Job title: Wallet Operation Specialist

Location: Paris, France

About Ledger

We’re a team of experts pushing the limits of what’s possible, united by our common goal to unlock true freedom through digital ownership, making technology accessible for all. We believe in a world where users, creators and enterprises manage their value with ownership and freedom. Our curiosity drives us to innovate, empowering individuals on a global scale. We believe change is constant and our team moves forward as one, with a culture of problem-solving where every employee is empowered and supported to challenge tradition and create solutions. Our mission is simple: to make self-custody accessible and give people the keys to their own financial futures. If you want to make a true impact, we want you to join us at Ledger.

At Ledger, we’re proud to be the global platform for digital assets and Web3, with over 20% of the world’s crypto assets secured through our Ledger devices. With our headquarters in Paris, and offices in Vierzon, Grenoble, Montpellier, London, Portland, Geneva, Zurich and Central Singapore, we have a team of around 600 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets – including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 7.5 millions units already sold in 200 countries.

The Team

The Wallet Operations and Optimization Team is responsible for looking at the ongoing performance and experience quality of the Ledger Wallet (the application itself and its services) from the point of view of the end Consumer and the point of View of the Providers delivering the Ledger Wallet services. In order to complete this task, the team will build, observe and monitor a broad set of internal, external and customer related indicators, KPIs and dashboards as well as directly observe the Wallet experience. Based on procedures the team will look for and investigate potential issues, alert, when relevant directly remedy some situations especially partner related, as well as reach out to other internal groups and external partners in order for them to take action. The team is equally a resource for other teams in order to clarify issues and take actions within their remit.

The team will actively contribute to delivering the best possible consumer and partner experience of the current version of the Wallet, contribute to identifying optimisation and ultimately impact consumers and partners satisfaction, engagement, NPS, and Ledger revenue.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a specialist in the team, you perform the key tasks described in the mission. In particular, you will interface directly with various service providers, stakeholders, support and account management, and a large number of key teams in the Ledger organization, in particular within customer success, business line management and technology. Keeping the interest of the consumers and service providers in mind, you will demonstrate a high degree of curiosity and initiative in identifying issues while staying within the agreed roles and procedures in the resolution.

What We’re Looking For

Proven experience (2+ years) in a technical customer success, partner/account management, or incident management role.Experience assimilating and reviewing data from monitoring and alerting tools (e.g., Datadog, Tableau, Mixpanel).Ability to build strong relationships with partners while staying objective and enforcing agreed standards.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills and the ability to work under pressure.Strong process management skills and technical literacy, with experience in top-level support for businesses in the tech or blockchain industry.Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, with a "Customer-First" attitude.A genuine interest in cryptocurrencies and/or blockchain environments.


Bonus Points

Knowledge of ITIL or other incident management frameworks.ITIL, SRE, or similar operational certifications.


Benefits

At Ledger, we are dedicated to continually investing in our employees which is why we offer more than just salaries; we provide comprehensive compensation packages that include a wide range of benefits. Here are some of the benefits you can look forward to:

Flexible work options - Our hybrid policy allows employees to work from home up to 3 times per weekHealth & Wellness support - Health and Life Insurance.Financial growth opportunities - Employees can become shareholders in Ledger as well as other financial benefits depending on your country of work.Commuter allowance - Ledger offers a commuter allowance to contribute to your preferred means of transportation.Learning & Development - A comprehensive suite of training solutions providing a personalised learning experience for every employee.


For regionally specific benefits, your Talent Acquisition contact will be able to provide you with more information.

We’re committed to building an inclusive hiring process. If you need any adjustments or accommodations, just let us know, we’ll do our best to support you.

jobs.title: Editorial and Content Lead
jobs.description:
YOUR WORK ENVIRONMENT

Why AXA? Every day, we work together for human progress by protecting what matters. A mission that puts a smile on your face and makes you want to get up in the morning!

One of the world's leading insurers in the protection of property, people and assets, AXA is 145,000 employees and contributors who are committed to our customers on a daily basis, 51 countries in which we distribute our products and services and more than 90 million customers who place their trust in us worldwide. As a responsible corporate citizen, AXA is committed to social and environmental causes on a daily basis. We are committed to an inclusive policy that recognizes and values individual differences. Do these ambitions speak to you? Then come and change the world with us!

The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.

Your Role And Responsabilities

Within the Group, you will join the Brand, Communication and Sustainability Department.

Within this Department, you will be part of AXA Group’s Digital Communication Team, a core unit within the Group Communication & Engagement team, composed of about 10 multi-skilled professionals (project managers, editorial experts, social media strategists, product & tech leads).

Our ambition is to craft, deliver and amplify high-impact content that elevates AXA’s voice on key topics — from leadership and innovation to sustainability, inclusion, and employee culture. The team operates as a central content hub for the Group, working in partnership with brand, internal communication, HR, and entity communications teams across the globe. The environment is fast-paced, collaborative, and transformation-oriented, with a strong emphasis on digital innovation, social media influence, and narrative consistency across channels.

We are entering a new strategic cycle with three top priorities:

Inject creativity and storytelling at every levelAccelerate influence and engagement through social platforms and leadersExperiment, scale and inspire through bold, AI-augmented content formats

The Creative Content & Social Lead will be a cornerstone of this dynamic, bringing both vision and hands-on execution to life.

The team’s core mission is to design, produce and amplify high-quality corporate content aligned with the Group’s strategic priorities and values.

The Creative Content & Social Lead will work cross-functionally and will help shape new content standards while fostering creative excellence across the organization.

Why this role matters

At a time when content and communications are being deeply reshaped by AI, social-first behaviors, employee advocacy, and shifting audience expectations, AXA is elevating its global corporate narrative through digital channels. To help drive this change, we are recruiting a Creative Content & Social Lead to embed creative excellence and format innovation at the heart of our global communications.

This is not just a content role: it’s a strategic and creative mission. It requires a sharp sense of storytelling, a deep understanding of social platforms, an eye for impactful design and motion, and the agility to co-create with stakeholders across Internal comms, Press, Branding, HR, Sustainability, and Tech & Business. This is a unique opportunity to shape how a global brand like AXA tells its story in the next era — human, digital, social-first, and bold.

Responsibilities

The Creative Content & Social Lead will play a central role in accelerating AXA’s corporate content impact by bringing creativity, storytelling, and social-first thinking to the heart of our communications. This role bridges strategic narratives and compelling digital formats, ensuring our content stands out, connects, and inspires across platforms. In this context, the key responsibilities are:

Elevate the team’s creative ambition across formats, channels (internal & external), and campaigns.Lead creative ideation and content-driven thinking to boost Employee Engagement, Social Engagement, AXA’s influence, distinctiveness, and impact.

Creative Direction & Content Ideation

Lead creative ideation for key campaigns and content initiatives (brand, social impact, leadership, innovation)Translate strategic messages into engaging, human-centered content formats: short videos, carousels, podcast scripts, reels, infographics, interactive visualsEnsure brand tone, consistency and originality across all creative assets

Social-First Strategy

Boost AXA’s presence and influence on social platforms by driving format innovation and content optimizationBoost Employee engagement and Sociable platform adoption by driving format innovation, new feature usage and content optimizationPartner with the Social Media Manager, Advocacy Manager and Internal communication lead to amplify social media engagement, leadership voices and employee engagementLead content pilots using emerging platforms

YOUR PROFILE

Solid background in digital content, brand storytelling, or creative social mediaExperience in both concept development and content executionPrevious exposure to corporate topics or complex organizations is a strong plusFluency in English; French is a plus depending on stakeholder interactions

Skills

Look at this handy list to help you decide if you’ve got the right skills and experience for this role. We’re looking for someone with:

Strong creative mindset and storytelling abilityDeep understanding of social media culture and content trendsEye for design, motion, and interactive formats (not necessarily execution, but vision)Editorial sensitivity and attention to tone and narrativeAgile, collaborative, and user-centricInterest in innovation, tools, and experimenting (AI, co-creation, real-time formats)

WHY JOIN US

You Will Join

A responsible company, towards people, including its employees and customers, and towards the planet A company with strong valuesA company promoting internal mobility and the training of its employeesA company offering many benefits (learn more here: Reward & Benefits | AXA Group)A flexible company, allowing hybrid work, in the office and from home.

In line with our commitments, we celebrate each new hire by taking action for global reforestation: we plant a tree for every recruitment. So, are you ready to apply?

jobs.title: Lead Marketing
jobs.description:
TL;DR:

Bonx is a VC-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the ERP market. We are hiring one of our first key employees, a Founding Marketing Lead, who will be responsible for massively scaling our marketing engine. You’ll be in charge of building a best-in-class marketing foundation, across content, demand generation, community, and brand.

📍 Great Location: Paris, in our offices in the Marais (75003).

💶 Salary: 85 to 95k fixed + variable + BSPCE

📑 Contract Type: Full-time, benefits per the SYNTEC collective agreement.

👏 Reporting Line: Co-founder & CEO (Alexandre).

About Bonx And Our Mission

Founded by Alexandre Barroux (CEO) and Rémi Bèges (CTO), Bonx aims to disrupt a 50-year-old ERP market dominated by legacy players. ERPs are critical software for manufacturing companies, yet they are notoriously difficult to implement and use. Across Europe, 2.5 million SMEs are underserved by outdated ERP solutions or choose not to adopt them due to complexity. Same in the USA.

Bonx, established two years ago within OSS Ventures, has developed the first no-code, AI-driven industrial ERP. Our clients have implemented Bonx 10 times faster than traditional ERPs and continuously evolve their interfaces independently.

We aim to become the European leader in industrial ERPs within 5 years, and the global leader within 8–10 years. To support this ambitious growth, we are seeking a Founding Marketing Lead to join our dynamic team.

About The Role

This is a founding marketing role, working directly with the CEO and the leadership team. You will act as the fuel to our growth engine, generating awareness, building community, and creating trust at scale. You’ll play a key part in building a world-class marketing motion at Bonx.

Your Primary Responsibilities Include

Co-building and executing Bonx’s content, community, and demand generation strategy.Driving brand awareness and positioning to make Bonx the reference ERP for industrial SMEs.Creating marketing assets that resonate deeply with our ICP (founders, CEOs, COOs of manufacturers).Collaborating with the sales team to ensure marketing and sales are perfectly aligned.Analyzing and improving campaign effectiveness based on data and feedback.Informing and enriching the CRM with marketing-driven lead data.Building scalable, efficient marketing processes and automations.

What We Offer

A Real Career Accelerator: Join a top-tier SaaS team and build your marketing career the right way.Uniquely Ambitious Project: Join one of the most promising Industry 4.0 startups in Europe, backed by world-class investors (Lakestar, Dynamo Ventures, OSS Ventures, Kima Ventures…).Inspiring Clients: Engage with innovative and ambitious industrial entrepreneurs.A Culture of Fun and Excellence: We aim to be the best in the ERP world – not only in performance but also in the energy and joy we bring to work every day.Growth Potential: This role is a stepping stone to future marketing leadership roles within Bonx.Global Reach: You’ll be part of a team impacting manufacturing SMEs in France, Europe, and the USA.

You’re a Great Fit If You Have

4–8 years of marketing experience in B2B SaaS, with outstanding results.High energy: you bring momentum, creativity, and drive to the team.Strong ambition and hunger to learn fast in a demanding environment.Demonstrated excellence in content creation, community building, or demand generation.A desire to discover and experience what it’s like to work at an early-stage startup.Fluent in French & English.You are an “idea” person, you come up all the time with creative ideas to make the business known.You obsess with promoting the business.

This Role Is Not For You If

jobs.title: Email Marketing Associate
jobs.description:
Maneuver Marketing
Our Vision, Mission & Success are fuelled by our commitment to be a driving force of positive change to the health of everyday consumers, providing conscious, high-quality & innovative supplement products.
In just 5 years, we kicked off our own DTC Health & Wellness brand from scratch and scaled it to USD$100M+ in annual sales, serving more than 3,000,000 customers worldwide with an average of 4,000 daily orders across 9 SKUs.
These results caught the attention of The Financial Times, as they ranked us among APAC top High-Growth Companies in 2023. This is just the beginning of our journey though, and you could be part of the next stage of our growth!
Your Next RoleWe are looking for a proactive, detail-oriented and data-obsessed Email Marketing Associate with at least 3 years of experience to join our fast-growing team. Your primary focus will be to help drive customer retention, revenue growth, and brand loyalty through highly effective email and SMS marketing.
You? You're totally obsessed with building smart automations, building converting lists, slicing up clean segments, protecting deliverability, ensuring flawless execution from technical setup to post-send data analysis. and turning data into winning campaigns and flows. You're fluent in Klaviyo, can set up rock-solid flows and campaigns, and know how to make data-driven decisions that drive revenue and growth.
If that's you, read on. 👇
You'll work closely with our retention manager, copywriters, and designers to bring emails and texts to life and continuously optimize performance through data-driven A/B testing.And, also collaborate with cross-functional teams across SMS, direct mail, product, business development, marketplace and analytics to ensure a cohesive customer journey and consistent messaging. The ideal candidate has a passion for email marketing, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and combines technical precision with strategic thinking.
What You'll Do
Klaviyo Flow Setup & Management• Co-develop customer journey map with retention manager and translate the plan into emails, SMS, and DM flows• Specify flow filters, triggers, conditional splits, target audience, and Klaviyo settings essential to deliver the optimal impact for the flows• Implement advanced automation and segmentation strategies for acquisition and retention — including onboarding, replenishment, cross-sells, winbacks, abandons, and new offer/message tests.• Map out flow logic to ensure the right messages reach the right customers at the right time, minimizing overlap and communication fatigue.• Maintain and improve existing flows, auditing performance and proposing adjustments based on data insights.• Document all flow structures and logic for team visibility and future reference.• Identify opportunities to personalize flow content based on customer behavior, purchase history, and engagement signals.• Collaborate with creative and copy teams to ensure flow content aligns with brand voice and customer journey goals.• Test all new flows rigorously to confirm technical accuracy, proper audience targeting, and optimal deliverability.• Monitor flow performance post-launch and proactively troubleshoot any issues (e.g. errors in triggers, audience misalignment, drops in engagement).• Review and test every flow to check for typos, grammatical errors, layout issues, optimizations across mobile and desktop; and to ensure correct segmentation, logic, links, formatting, and deliverability.• Monitor performance immediately after launch and again at the 24-hour, 48-hour, 1 week mark to catch and fix any issues fast.
Campaign Strategy & Development• Manage the end-to-end execution of one-time and recurring email campaigns (including set up and QA for typos, grammatical errors, layout issues, optimizations across mobile and desktop, correct links, correct segments), ensuring they align with overarching marketing and retention strategies.• Help Build and maintain a content calendar/strategy to support promotional, evergreen, and seasonal campaigns to meet retention, acquisition, email, and SMS KPIs• Collaborate with copywriters and designers to create compelling conversion-centric email creative and email templates that meets production deadlines and maintain brand quality.• Segment and target audiences for campaigns using behavioral, transactional, and demographic data.• Configure all technical elements of campaigns in Klaviyo, including sending profiles, timing, throttling, and exclusion logic.• Analyze campaign results and prepare actionable reports to inform future strategy and optimizations.• Keep documentation up-to-date for campaign processes, templates, and learnings to improve efficiency and team knowledge sharing.• Explore new Klaviyo features and tools that could enhance campaign capabilities and effectiveness.• Monitor performance immediately after launch and again at the 24-hour, 48-hour, 1 week mark to catch and fix any issues fast.
Klaviyo List, Segment, Filter, and Tag Management• Manage segmentation, tagging, deliverability management, and account structure hygiene inside Klaviyo.• Assess, optimize, and build segments for targeting offers, product launches, and email/sms optimizations based on RFM, customer behavior, lifecycle stage, engagement, and other variables.• Design and optimize pop-ups and zero-party data capture (e.g. quizzes, gated content) to grow the email list and fuel personalized segmentation and messaging.• A/B split test pop ups to optimize list growth• Help design and optimize lead nurturing and conversion sequences that move subscribers into buyers — and buyers into loyalists.• Maintain a clean, scalable list structure with consistent tagging and naming conventions.
Deliverability Optimization• Familiarize and optimize email deliverability architecture (eg. key kpis to improve deliverability and inbox placement, SPF/DKIM/DMARC configurations, ESP updates).• Protect and strengthen our email deliverability by monitoring key metrics and following best practices (SPF, DKIM, DMARC setups/updates, Glockapp tests, Google Postmaster and engagement monitoring).• Design mini-projects to continually improve sender reputation and inbox placement prioritizing based on highest impact.• Quickly troubleshoot bounce rate spikes, spam complaints, or other deliverability red flags.
Measurement and A/B Testing• Report daily, weekly, and monthly on campaign and flow performance — focusing on key revenue, engagement, deliverability metrics plus lift, not just vanity metrics.• Run continuous A/B tests on subject lines, segmentation tactics, offer framing, timing, and design elements.• Work closely with the measurement team to build reports using Google Data Studio and our data warehouse, or similar.• Analyze and present clear insights from performance trends to guide future strategies.• Continuously measure and optimize the performance of initiatives while assessing data and culling strategic insights to lead email and SMS projects• Demonstrate working knowledge of attribution methodology eg. first click, last click.
Project Management• Collaborate with internal teams across product, marketplace, operations, customer service, influencer, data, and growth departments• Work closely with copywriter, designer, freelancers, and colleagues to meet quality standards and content production timelines working with a minimum 2 week buffer• Project coordinate copywriting and design using proper tags and labels with direction from retention manager.
External Stakeholder Management• Collaborate with ad agency to review and approve project roadmaps, flow charts, flow content, reports, and design• Work with Klaviyo and Recart vendors to optimize campaigns, flows, pop ups, segments, and deliverability• Provide deliverables to Recart, such as, copy, MMS, approved campaign schedules, flow content.
Invoice Management• Compile and review email and SMS invoices to ensure accuracy• Submit invoices for approval and follow up to ensure timely payments
Who You Are• 3-5 years of direct, hands-on email marketing experience, ideally for DTC or eCommerce brands.• Deep Klaviyo expertise — including flows, campaigns, segmentation, tagging, and reporting.• Strong project management skills — you know how to juggle timelines, people, and moving pieces without dropping the ball.• Excellent QA skills — attention to detail is your superpower.• Analytical mindset — you love digging into data and finding actionable trends, not just reporting numbers.• Strong grasp of direct response marketing principles (awareness, market sophistication, persuasion, objection handling, hooks and leads).• Proven experience designing, executing, and iterating on A/B tests.• Understanding of deliverability fundamentals and best practices.• Comfort working cross-functionally with copy, creative, retention, and analytics teams.• Ability to thrive in a fast-paced ambiguous environment where priorities can shift quickly• Proactive: can take initiative and problem-solve• Clear, respectful, and prompt communication with internal teams and external vendors• Detail-oriented — details in flows, accuracy in invoices, and quality in content are important to you• Growth mindset, adaptable, open to feedback, and driven to continuously improve how things are done• Strong "builder" desire - we built our brand to 9 figures in revenue profitably with ~30 full-time employees and this would not have happened without a strong work ethic and a mission-driven culture. We aim to build the brand to 10 figures by the end of the decade, and this requires a strong sense of commitment to build something together with like-minded people.• Bonus: Basic Figma, HTML, or copywriting skills.

Vos principales missions :
1 – Mener des études consommateurs & marchéEn collaboration étroite avec les équipes Production et Marketing, vous réaliserez des analyses approfondies de nos titres à venir.Cela inclut la collecte d’insights sur les attentes des joueurs, le positionnement, les tendances du marché et les stratégies de prix.Vous serez chargé(e) de présenter vos résultats aux équipes projet, aux développeurs et aux partenaires externes.Vous mettrez régulièrement à jour vos recherches tout au long du cycle de développement des jeux.Selon les besoins des projets, vous serez amené(e) à cadrer et mettre en œuvre des études consommateurs (questionnaires, sondages, focus groups), avec le soutien éventuel de prestataires externes.

Strategy & Ownership

Own the paid growth strategy across Meta, Google Ads (Performance Max, Search, YouTube), Meta, TikTok in 50+ markets, and evaluate new channels as needed.Define market priorities, and channel and device mix (web vs app, Android vs iOS, mobile web vs desktop) Build a structured testing roadmap for channels, audiences, and creatives.


Execution & Daily Optimisation

Data Tracking & Reporting

French is a strong plus.You possess a strong understanding of tracking and attribution. You can brief, iterate, and scale winners without hurting the brand.You are an excellent communicator and team player with proven collaborative skills.You are comfortable in fast paced environments, organised & able to deliver accurate and timely results on close deadlines.

🚀 You’ll operate in a key role in the development of a fast-growing travel-tech startup.

Product Marketing Manager

 Paris CDIPostuler 

À propos

Le vieillissement de la population entraine une augmentation considérable du recours au soin, mais les lourdeurs administratives continuent d’éroder le temps consacré aux patient·es. Fluidifier le parcours de soin grâce au digital se fait donc de plus en plus nécessaire. Dans ce but, une multitude d’outils existent, mais l’absence de compatibilité avec les systèmes existants limitent l’utilisation que les professionnel·les de santé peuvent en faire (données incomplètes, parcours de soins fragmenté…). C’est pour débloquer le potentiel de la e-santé en créant des synergies et un partage données entre l’ensemble de ces solutions que Lifen, aujourd’hui actrice du Next 40, est née.

Sa plateforme facilite l’intégration de solutions innovantes à l’hôpital et permet l’échange de données entre les différents acteur·rices (hôpitaux, cliniques, médecins de ville, État, éditeur·rices de logiciels…). Cette solution répond aussi aux enjeux gouvernementaux portants sur la modernisation de notre système de soin. En optimisant la communication et le relai d’informations entre les établissements, les équipes de Lifen font économiser un temps précieux au personnel soignant. Elles lui permettent surtout de se concentrer sur son cœur de métier : l’accompagnement des malades.

Aujourd’hui, ce sont plus de 850 cliniques et hôpitaux et 120 000 professionnel·les de santé qui ont déjà adopté Lifen. Plus de 4 millions de documents médicaux transitent ainsi chaque mois, grâce à son application de transmission sécurisée.

Descriptif du poste

Pourquoi Lifen ?

Lifen met l'intelligence des données au service des soignants. Depuis 2015, nous transformons fondamentalement la façon dont les données médicales sont accessibles, structurées et partagées pour améliorer la qualité des soins.

Notre Impact Concret

 800+ établissements nous font déjà confiance 150 000 professionnels de santé gagnent du temps grâce à nos solutions 40% des comptes rendus médicaux français passent par notre technologie Des milliers d'heures rendues aux soignants pour ce qui compte vraiment : soigner

Plus récemment, et avec le soutien de France 2030, nous créons des solutions d'intelligence artificielle structurant les données cliniques et accélérant la recherche médicale en France et à l'international.

Aujourd'hui, nous sommes 140 Lifeners partageant une mission commune : construire un monde en meilleure santé.

L'aventure ne fait que commencer ! 🚀

🛠️ L’équipe Product Marketing

L’équipe Product Marketing Chez Lifen Assure Le Lien Entre Le Produit, Le Marché Et Nos Utilisateurs, Pour Clarifier Notre Proposition De Valeur Et Accélérer L’adoption. Nous Intervenons Sur Trois Axes Principaux

 Comprendre les besoins : écouter les clients et le marché pour savoir ce qui compte vraiment. Lancer les produits avec succès : préparer des stratégies claires pour que nos solutions soient adoptées. Expliquer simplement ce qu’on fait : définir des messages percutants qui montrent en quoi Lifen se démarque.

Au Quotidien, Nous Aidons Les Équipes Commerciales

 en leur donnant des outils (pitch deck, cas clients, réponses aux objections), en mettant en oeuvre des webinaires business pour générer des leads, en mesurant l’impact (performance des campagnes, taux de satisfaction, taux d'usage des nouvelles features).

 Minimum 4 ans d’expérience en Product Marketing ou marketing produit (B2B, SaaS, santé ou tech). Expérience dans le secteur de la santé (e-santé, medtech, établissement, éditeur) ou forte expérience sur marchés B2B SaaS complexes (data, legaltech, fintech, RH, assurance…). Curiosité, goût pour l’innovation et l'utilisations de l'IA pour automatiser son workflow, capacité à apprendre et transmettre. jobs.description:
【Job Responsibilities】

【Job Requirements】

À propos de JD.com

JD.com, également connu sous le nom de Jingdong, est l’un des leaders mondiaux du e-commerce et des services logistiques intégrés. Coté au NASDAQ et à la Bourse de Hong Kong, le groupe s’est imposé comme un acteur incontournable en Asie grâce à son excellence opérationnelle, sa technologie propriétaire et son modèle centré sur la supply chain de bout en bout.

Avec plus de 580 millions de clients actifs, JD.com transforme les standards du commerce en ligne, en combinant richesse de l’offre, logistique ultra-rapide et expérience client irréprochable.

Déjà présent dans plusieurs pays, JD.com accélère aujourd’hui son expansion européenne, avec le lancement de ses opérations en France.

Le poste 

En tant que Product Manager Expérience Utilisateur pour Joybuy France, vous serez l’interface clé entre les besoins des utilisateurs locaux et la stratégie produit définie par le siège mondial.

Vous explorerez en profondeur le marché français, conduirez des recherches utilisateurs, définirez l’orientation produit et collaborerez avec les équipes produit et tech du siège pour concevoir, optimiser et livrer les produits front-end (App/Web) adaptés à la culture française et aux habitudes locales.

Votre travail contribuera directement à améliorer l’engagement, la satisfaction et l'efficacité de l’expérience utilisateur.

Missions Principales

 Études de marché et recherches utilisateur :Mener des recherches approfondies sur les tendances du marché français et européen, les comportements utilisateurs, les spécificités culturelles et l’environnement concurrentiel.Diriger des recherches utilisateurs qualitatives et quantitatives (entretiens, sondages, tests d’utilisabilité, A/B testing) afin d’identifier les besoins profonds et les points de friction.Produire des livrables de qualité : rapports de recherche, personas, parcours utilisateurs, et autres supports pour éclairer les décisions produit. Planification produit & conception :Piloter l’optimisation UX/UI et l’innovation fonctionnelle des produits front-end destinés au marché français (App/Web), en s’appuyant sur les données utilisateurs et les objectifs business.Définir les besoins produit, rédiger des user stories claires et des PRD (Product Requirement Documents), créer des maquettes haute fidélité et des prototypes.Collaborer avec les designers pour garantir que les interfaces répondent aux attentes esthétiques et d’usage des utilisateurs français, tout en respectant la cohérence globale de la marque. Communication & collaboration interculturelle :Agir en tant que "voix locale" de l’équipe produit mondiale en France, en communiquant de manière proactive et claire les besoins et spécificités du marché local.Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes produit, ingénierie et opérations du siège pour intégrer les fonctionnalités spécifiques à la France dans la roadmap globale.Gérer les priorités projets et les attentes des parties prenantes, en coordonnant les ressources de développement pour garantir des livraisons de qualité dans les délais impartis. Analyse des données & itération continue :Suivre et analyser les principaux indicateurs post-lancement (taux de conversion, rétention, engagement, etc.) pour évaluer la performance des fonctionnalités.À partir des données et des retours utilisateurs, proposer des pistes d’optimisation pour assurer une itération rapide et continue de l’expérience produit.

Profil Recherché

Expérience :

Minimum 10-15 ans d’expérience, dont au moins 5 en tant que Product Manager UX ou dans un rôle similaire, idéalement dans un environnement e-commerce ou plateforme B2C.Expérience avérée dans la conduite de projets de localisation produit ou de lancement de fonctionnalités majeures "from scratch"Maîtrise des méthodologies de recherche utilisateur et des outils associés (ex. : Figma, Sketch, Miro, UserTesting.com).Habitude de travailler avec des équipes multiculturelles et réparties sur plusieurs fuseaux horaires.

Compétences & Aptitudes

Exigence forte en matière d’expérience utilisateur, sens du détail, capacités analytiques et de résolution de problèmes élevées.Excellentes compétences en communication, avec la capacité d’expliquer clairement des concepts produit et de défendre des propositions de valeur auprès de différents interlocuteurs.Prise de décision guidée par la donnée, avec une bonne maîtrise des outils d’analyse (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc.).Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais indispensable, y compris à l'oralAutonomie, sens de l’initiative, capacité à évoluer dans un environnement dynamique.Fort sens de l’engagement et esprit d’équipe collaboratif.

【About JD.com】

JD.com (NASDAQ: JD and HKEX: 9618), also known as JINGDONG, has evolved from a pioneering e-commerce platform into a leading technology and service provider with supply chain at its core. Renowned for its supply chain innovation and excellence, JD.com has expanded into sectors including retail, technology, logistics, healthcare, and more, aiming to transform traditional business models with cutting-edge digital solutions. Ranked 47th on the Fortune Global 500, JD.com is China’s largest retailer by revenue. In 2023, JD.com reported revenues of US$152.8 billion and served approximately 600 million active customers.

【Our International Business】

We are dedicated to building a digitally intelligent, cross-border supply chain and global retail infrastructure. Leveraging our global supply chain capabilities, JD.com continues to expand in markets where our competitive strengths shine. Currently, JD.com operates globally, with business activities in countries such as China, the U.S., U.K., Netherlands, France, Germany, Spain, Brazil, Hungary, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, Indonesia, Saudi Arabia, the UAE, and many others, reaching customers in every corner of the world.

【European Omni-channel Retail Brand “Ochama”】

Ochama is an innovative B2C omni-channel retailer that leverages state-of-the-art retail and supply chain solutions to offer a comprehensive, full-category assortment of both top-rated and budget-friendly products at the best prices. As a subsidiary of JD.com, ochama utilizes advanced supply chain technologies and automated warehouses to redefine the shopping landscape. Our slogan, “Shopping made simple,” perfectly captures our mission. We are dedicated to fulfilling all our customers' needs and providing a shopping experience that is not only easy and convenient but also enjoyable and fun.

jobs.title: Senior Web Tracking Analyst, Marketing
jobs.description:
Who We Are Is What We Do.

Deel is the all-in-one payroll and HR platform for global teams. Our vision is to unlock global opportunity for every person, team, and business. Built for the way the world works today, Deel combines HRIS, payroll, compliance, benefits, performance, and equipment management into one seamless platform. With AI-powered tools and a fully owned payroll infrastructure, Deel supports every worker type in 150+ countries—helping businesses scale smarter, faster, and more compliantly.

Among the largest globally distributed companies in the world, our team of 6,000 spans more than 100 countries, speaks 74 languages, and brings a connected and dynamic culture that drives continuous learning and innovation for our customers.

Why should you be part of our success story?

As the fastest-growing Software as a Service (SaaS) company in history, Deel is transforming how global talent connects with world-class companies – breaking down borders that have traditionally limited both hiring and career opportunities. We're not just building software; we're creating the infrastructure for the future of work, enabling a more diverse and inclusive global economy. In 2024 alone, we paid $11.2 billion to workers in nearly 100 currencies and provided healthcare and benefits to workers in 109 countries—ensuring people get paid and protected, no matter where they are.

Our momentum is reflected in our achievements and customer satisfaction: CNBC Disruptor 50, Forbes Cloud 100, Deloitte Fast 500, and repeated recognition on Y Combinator’s top companies list – all while maintaining a 4.83 average rating from 15,000 reviews across G2, Trustpilot, Captera, Apple and Google.

Your experience at Deel will be a career accelerator. At the forefront of the global work revolution, you'll tackle complex challenges that impact millions of people's working lives. With our momentum—backed by a $12 billion valuation and $1 B in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR) in just over five years—you'll drive meaningful impact while building expertise that makes you a sought-after leader in the transformation of global work.

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with Marketing teams (Paid, Lifecycle, Regional, Brand, and Event Marketing) to ensure all digital campaigns and programs are tracked accurately and consistently.Own and maintain our web tracking framework across Google Tag Manager (client-side and server-side), and Amplitude.Design, implement, and validate data layer components, ensuring campaign UTMs, conversion events, and user interactions are captured correctly.Connect analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude) to ad platforms (Google Ads, Meta, LinkedIn, etc.) to share real-time conversion data for campaign optimization.Enable user journey analysis across the full funnel by implementing and integrating behavioral analytics tools (e.g., heatmaps, session replay, funnel visualization platforms such as Hotjar, Contentsquare, FullStory, or PostHog) to identify friction points and inform CRO strategies.Collaborate with Marketing Analysts and Analytics Engineers to ensure high-quality data flows into Snowflake, dbt models, and Looker dashboards.Partner with Marketing Operations and GTM Data teams to align tracking with Salesforce and HubSpot, ensuring end-to-end attribution of leads and opportunities.Work with Marketing and Product teams to build conversion-focused segmentation and personalization strategies, leveraging behavioral and lifecycle data (e.g., Amplitude, Braze, Snowflake) to improve engagement and activation.Partner with CRO leads to surface insights and optimization opportunities from tracking data, helping to shape testing roadmaps and improve funnel performance.Proactively identify gaps or inefficiencies in tracking and recommend scalable solutions to improve data accuracy and campaign measurement.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Marketing, or a related field.Hands-on experience with Google Tag Manager and strong understanding of data layer design.Working knowledge of web analytics tools (e.g., Amplitude).Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake) and data modeling (e.g., dbt).Basic understanding of JavaScript and how it applies to web tracking implementations.Solid understanding of digital marketing channels (paid search, paid social, display, email, organic, events) and their tracking requirements.Experience setting up integrations between analytics tools and advertising platforms.Experience with customer communication tools such as Braze, including a strong understanding of how to pass data from Amplitude and Snowflake into Braze for lifecycle campaign activation.Ability to define, monitor, and interpret conversion-related KPIs (e.g., conversion rate, funnel drop-off %, activation and retention rates, experiment uplift) to drive measurable improvements.Familiarity with behavioral and journey analytics tools (e.g., Hotjar, Contentsquare, FullStory, PostHog).Strong attention to detail and ability to troubleshoot technical tracking issues.Excellent communication skills; able to translate technical tracking concepts into clear guidance for marketing and operations stakeholders.Experience working in fast-paced, high-growth B2B SaaS environments is a plus.

Total Rewards

Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.

Some things you’ll enjoy

Stock grant opportunities dependent on your role, employment status and locationAdditional perks and benefits based on your employment status and countryThe flexibility of remote work, including optional WeWork access

Unless otherwise agreed, we will communicate with job applicants using Deel-specific emails, which include @deel.com and other acquired company emails like @payspace.com and @paygroup.com. You can view the most up-to-date job listings at Deel by visitingour careers page.

Deel is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects different abilities, backgrounds, beliefs, experiences, identities and perspectives.

Deel will provide accommodation on request throughout the recruitment, selection and assessment process for applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team at recruiting@deel.com of the nature of the accommodation that you may require, to ensure your equal participation.

jobs.title: Junior Insight & Measurement

At Unlimitail, we are building the future of retail media in Europe and LATAM, combining Carrefour Links' immense in-store and e-commerce assets with Publicis’ advanced retail media technology. Our ambition? To become the number one retail media platform in Continental Europe and South America. Already partnered with 35+ major players since our Vivatech launch, we're set to welcome many more retailers into our growing ecosystem.
Our mojo: We think big, act fast, and build something meaningful.
Role Overview:
As Junior Insight & Measurement, you will be reporting to the Head of Insights & Measurement, and play a key role in behavior of shopper analysis by leveraging our exclusive transactional data to help retailers and advertisers optimize the effectiveness of their Retail Media campaigns across all digital channels (onsite, open-web, social networks, etc.). Your mission: turn data into strategic insights and actionable recommendations to deliver real business impact.
Your Mission:
1. Turning data into consumer insightsDive into our 1st party data to understand shopping behaviors: profiles, loyalty, customer journeys, and consumption trends.Identify key performance indicators that enable brands to better understand their customers and guide strategic decisions.Work closely with the sales team to build differentiating arguments and strengthen the value of our offerings.

Measuring the effectiveness of Retail Media campaignsAssess campaign impact on sales and consumer engagement through data-driven analysis.Produce clear, inspiring, and action-oriented reports and presentations for our clients.Contribute to the development of new methodologies and enrich our portfolio of innovative studies.Monitor market developments, digital usage trends, and retail innovations through ongoing research.

An environment where data is at the core of strategy.The opportunity to work on innovative and high-visibility projects at the crossroads of digital, retail, and advertising.A passionate, collaborative, and impact-driven marketing team where your analyses truly make a difference for our clients.A chance to grow in a fast-evolving sector, shaped by the ongoing transformation of retail media.

We're looking for a talented and detail-oriented SEO Content Editor to join our growing team of gambling content specialists. jobs.title: Social Media Manager, France (12 month contract)
jobs.description:
Job Description

Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where And How You Can Work

Alongside our global campuses, we also collaborate with talented contractors from all over the world to help us achieve our crazy big goals. While we support flexible, remote-friendly ways of working, for this role we’re focusing on Paris so we can best support our teams and keep collaboration flowing.

This role is a 12-Month contract, working full-time hours.

What You’d Be Doing In This Role

We’re launching brand new social channels in France, and we’re looking for a creative and strategic storyteller to help shape how Canva shows up from day one. In this role, you’ll build our local social presence from the ground up; creating culturally relevant, native content that connects, entertains, and inspires.

This is a hybrid role for someone who blends content craft with platform expertise, and who’s just as confident ideating as they are publishing, engaging, and iterating. You don’t wait to brief...you’re the type to shoot, write, edit, and post if it means getting something great out the door fast.

You’ll bring a sharp understanding of local culture, trends, and creators, and know how to translate that into platform-native content that builds community and brand love.

At the moment, this role is focused on:

Launching and growing Canva’s social presence in France from the ground up — end-to-end ownership from strategy to publishing. Creating culturally relevant, native content that connects, inspires, and entertains across key platforms like TikTok and Instagram. Spotting trends and real-time moments to join conversations that matter to our community. Collaborating with agencies, freelancers, and creators to bring fresh local ideas to life. Engaging daily with your audience to build connection, spark joy, and fuel community growth. Localising global campaigns to make them resonate with French audiences. Partnering with cross-functional teams to align on local marketing goals and campaign strategies. Reporting on performance and applying insights to iterate and optimise for impact. Being a guardian of Canva’s voice — ensuring every post reflects our values and personality. 

You're probably a match if

You have extensive social media experience, especially focused on content creation and community engagement. You’re a hands-on creator — confident filming, editing, designing, writing, and posting on the fly. You know what works (and doesn’t) on TikTok, Instagram, and beyond — and can explain why. You’ve got a sharp eye for storytelling, a flair for design, and experience using Canva to bring ideas to life. You’re plugged into French culture, trends, and digital creators, and have a knack for translating it into content that lands. You’ve worked with creative partners, influencers, or agencies — and know how to get the best out of a brief. You’re a strong communicator, comfortable collaborating in English with a global team. You’re data-savvy — you know how to read performance metrics and turn insights into action. You’re proactive, self-motivated, and thrive in fast-paced, evolving environments. 

About The Team

You’ll be part of the International Marketing group, working closely with the local France team and the global social media team. Together, we’re on a mission to empower users everywhere to design—your storytelling will help make Canva one of the most loved and culturally relevant brands in France.

Other Stuff To Know

We make hiring decisions to engage contractors based on your experience, skills and passion. When you signify interest in the Project, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the contractor-accreditation interview process.

Please note that contractor-accreditation meetings are conducted virtually.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

jobs.title: Marketing Campaign Specialist
jobs.description:
OUR STORY:

🇪🇺 Join Scaleway and shape the sovereign cloud of tomorrow !

Since 1999, we have been designing secure, sustainable infrastructures aimed at supporting the most ambitious companies.

Historically known for our dedicated servers (Dedibox), we made a strategic shift to cloud computing in 2015. Staying true to our principles of simplicity, flexibility, and technical excellence, we have become one of the leading players in Europe in the sector.

With the rise of artificial intelligence, we have strengthened our commitment, supported by the Iliad Group, which is investing €3 billion to develop a serious, sovereign AI alternative to American and Asian giants.

Every day, thanks to our rich catalog of products and services (bare metal, containerization, serverless, AI, etc.), Scaleway proudly serves 38,000 private and public sector clients, from Photoroom to Mistral AI, Golem AI, and ADEME.

📍 Our offices are located in Paris, Lille, Toulouse, Bordeaux, Rouen, Rennes and Lyon.

WHY WE NEED YOU ?

Our growth is driving us to strengthen our Growth Marketing team to boost the impact of our marketing campaigns and better support our business objectives.

Your mission will be to design, execute, and optimize B2B email campaigns end-to-end in order to drive measurable engagement and business impact.

YOUR FUTURE TEAM

We work in a collaborative and international environment where the diversity of Scalers, combined with a spirit of sharing, helps bring new projects to life every day, advancing our ambitions together.

You will be part of a team of 5 people (4 permanent + 1 apprentice), working closely with Marketing Ops, Lifecycle Marketing, PMM, Field Marketers, Content, and Startup Program.

This position can be based in Paris or Lille. 

YOUR DAILY ROUTINE


 Manage and plan incoming briefs for marketing campaigns Design and prepare email campaigns (segmentation, targeting, personalization) Coordinate with cross-functional stakeholders (PMM, Field, Content…) Execute and launch campaigns in Hubspot Monitor performance and optimize campaigns for business KPIs (beyond open/click rates) Ensure compliance with GDPR and best practices in email UX and design Report on results and document campaigns Explore new trends and propose innovative approaches in email marketing



About You
HARDSKILLS :


 2–3 years of experience in email campaign management, ideally in B2B SaaS/Tech Mastery of a marketing automation tool (Hubspot preferred; Marketo, Pardot also relevant) Strong knowledge of segmentation, personalization, and targeting strategies Good understanding of email design, copywriting, and UX best practices Data-driven mindset with ability to analyze KPIs and optimize for business results Excellent French and English level (mandatory) 



SOFTSKILLS :


 Rigorous and detail-oriented (no broken links or targeting mistakes) Organized and able to manage multiple campaigns simultaneously Initiative-driven, capable of proposing improvements (not just executing) Results-oriented, focused on business impact rather than vanity metrics Curious and eager to stay up to date with email and marketing trends



WHAT YOU WILL FIND AT SCALEWAY ++++

Hybrid work: We offer up to 3 days of remote work per week.

Offices: Our offices are spacious, dynamic workspaces with bold design, conveniently located near public transport. Most of our offices feature outdoor spaces (terraces) and bike parking facilities.

Dining: Our chef provides a healthy meal service at the headquarters, and breakfast is available across all our sites year-round. Scalers working from regional sites enjoy a Swile card for lunches.

Well-being commitments: Whether it’s access to a gym, daycare places, or discounted services for caring services, Scaleway is committed to supporting Scalers in maintaining a balanced life.

International environment: With dozens of nationalities, Scaleway offers a stimulating environment where English is as widely spoken as French.

jobs.title: Senior Recommendations Editor
